body_html:
Perhaps not natively, but you can try compiling in a docker container - https://www.tensorflow.org/serving/docker

If you're going to use a docker container that sets up a linux environment, you can also just apt-get install the ModelServer (v1.4 uses TF 1.4), unless you wanted to compile from source. Apt-get instructions can be found here.
body_text:
Perhaps not natively, but you can try compiling in a docker container - https://www.tensorflow.org/serving/docker
If you're going to use a docker container that sets up a linux environment, you can also just apt-get install the ModelServer (v1.4 uses TF 1.4), unless you wanted to compile from source. Apt-get instructions can be found here.
body:
Perhaps not natively, but you can try compiling in a docker container - https://www.tensorflow.org/serving/docker

If you're going to use a docker container that sets up a linux environment, you can also just `apt-get install` the ModelServer (v1.4 uses TF 1.4), unless you wanted to compile from source. Apt-get instructions can be found [here](https://www.tensorflow.org/serving/setup).
